sub_title: Oral historian, researcher, heritage professional, educator, Tracing Your Roots
summary:
I am an oral historian, an educator, a researcher, and a writer. My experience & expertise:
Oral history ~Qualitative methods ~field based research ~lecturing bachelor students ~developing and coordinating curricula ~individual student supervision ~interviewing & collecting life stories ~conducting and coordinating oral history projects ~organizing story telling workshops ~ providing oral history training and workshops ~writing ~blogging

My activities: 
As an oral historian, I collect life stories of migrant families and their offspring in books, blogs, websites, and exhibitions. Being born into a family that was diverse in terms of gender, race, class, and sexuality, I know by experience what it means to be silenced and marginalized. By collecting the life stories of migrant families, I encourage them to speak up and become the owner of their own (hi)stories, thus countering dominant narratives around migrants and the or offspring. 
My latest oral history projects are the storytelling project Antara Nusa based on my latest book Antara Nusa that reveals the lives and experiences of elderly Amsterdammers who have roots in the former Dutch East Indies/Indonesia. Check https://lmpublishers.nl/catalogus/antara-nusa/.  
With our curriculum Ancestors Unknown Nederland, we encourage school kids in diverse classrooms to discover their ancestors and family histories through genealogy lessons (oral history interviewing and archival search) and history lessons on colonial and migration histories. Our recent program 'Tracing Your Roots' invites young adults in the former Dutch East Indies to pursuit the same search for their roots and their ancestors, thus encouraging them to envision their own identity and relation to our colonial past. 
Next to my work as an oral historian, I have 10 years of experience in lecturing in qualitative research methods and supervising bachelor students in their thesis. 
Next to these projects, I'm currently working on finalizing my PhD on migration, family, and identity in the life stories of Javanese-Surinamese women in the Netherlands 

My qualities: 
Enthusiastic, empathic, dedicated, persistent, and hard working. 
Learning only occurs outside your comfortzone, Nothing is impossible until it is done!

treasury_media.title: At the opening of my exhibition 'Van Daar & Van Hier' at the Limburgs Museum
treasury_media.description: In de tweede helft van 2020 werkte ik als gastcurator mee aan de expositie 'Van Daar & Van Hier'. In deze expo zien we de 25 deelnemers aan de Tracing Your Roots editie in Limburg in gesprek gaan met hun (groot)ouders, in een poging het Indisch Zwijgen te doorbreken en ruimte te scheppen voor heling en verzoening. Te zien van december 2020 t/m 5 september 2021 in het Limburgs Museum in Venlo

treasury_media.title: Giving a lecture on 130 years of Javanese migration
treasury_media.description: Ter gelegenheid van 130 jaar Javaanse migratie gaf ik op 30 november 2020 tijdens de Maand van de Geschiedenis een lezing in museum Bronbeek, met bijzondere aandacht voor de levensverhalen van Javaans-Surinaamse vrouwen

treasury_media.title: Hosting an intergenerational story telling workshop at the Tracing Your Roots Family day
treasury_media.description: Tracing Your Roots is een educatief programma waarin ik jongeren (15-35 jaar) met wortels in Indië/Indonesië uitnodig om op zoek te gaan naar hun voorouders en familiegeschiedenis. Het programma biedt naast workshops in stamboomonderzoek en oral history interviewen toegang tot de eigen geschiedenis via gastlessen verzorgd door experts afkomstig uit de eigen gemeenschappen. Het programma wordt afgesloten met een intergenerationele Familiedag. September 2019

treasury_media.title: Teaching Oral History in Suriname
treasury_media.description: In de zomer van 2019 verzorgde ik een cursus Oral History in Suriname, in samenwerking met het Amsterdam Museum en Museum Fort Nieuw Amsterdam. Dit in het kader van een twinningproject rondom storytelling & Oral History. Dit jaar hopen wij het project te vervolgen

treasury_media.title: Boek Antara Nusa - LM Publishers (februari 2018)
treasury_media.description: Door de jaren heen is er heel wat geschreven over afwikkeling en verwerking van het einde van Indië. Opvallend dominant is daarbij de stem van de totoks [witte Nederlanders]. Dit boek wil de lezer een alternatief, meerstemmig perspectief aanbieden. Aan het woord komen ouderen van Indische, Molukse, Timorese, Indonesisch-Chinese en Surinaamse afkomst, die ieder hun eigen licht werpen op de periode van kolonialisme, oorlog, dekolonisatie en migratie naar Nederland. Verschenen 26 februari 2018

treasury_media.title: From left to right: Helen Sumter, Dana Saxon, and me as the Ancestors Unknown Nederland team

profile_positions.title: Board Member

profile_positions.description: My dissertation is concerned with race, class, gender and sexuality in the (re)construction of female identity among 3 generations of Javanese-Surinamese women in postcolonial Holland. While analyzing their life stories, I try to examine how different generations of Javanese-Surinamese women look back at their history of double migration that was fostered by Dutch colonialism, and how their experience with colonial migration affects the way they negotiate their female identity in present, postcolonial Holland.
profile_positions.title: Phd candidate

profile_positions.description:
Zieraad Foundation was founded by Helen Sumter and myself. We use oral history as a tool to connect worlds, people, histories, and narratives that normally remain separated. We do so by hosting story telling workshops, providing oral history trainings, and sharing their stories in books, articles, and blogs, on websites and in exhibitions. 
By making untold (hi)stories heard, we hope to enable communities to regain ownership over their own histories. 
In 2017, we launched our curriculum Ancestors unKnown: an educational tool that encourages students (10-14 years) to discover their ancestors and gain access to shared (colonia) histories. 
In 2019, we launched Tracing Your Roots: a, similar program designed for yound adults with roots in the former Dutch Indies.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder of Stichting Zieraad

profile_positions.title: Academic Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
As a custom program developer I developed and coordinated short term study programs around gender and sexuality and race, migration & black diaspora. 
As academic advisor I provided a field study seminar where I focused on field-based research and (oral) history) interviewing. 
As a lecturer I invite my students to move beyond their own perspectives and truly open up to the communities and individuals that they want to learn from. Not so much to explain and predict human behavior but to understand their lived experiences, and the way they make sense of their lives and experiences.
profile_positions.title: Custom program developer & Academic advisor at SIT Amsterdam

company.name: SIT Study Abroad Amsterdam / World Learning

profile_positions.company: SIT Study Abroad Amsterdam / World Learning
profile_positions.description:
SIT Study Abroad Amsterdam, as part of World Learning, has worldwide nearly 75 academic semester and summer programs for American students in 50 different countries. 
In Amsterdam, we run the study program 'International Perspectives on Sexuality and Gender'. 
As Academic Director, I  was responsible for the academic content of the program, the staff, and the students.
profile_positions.title: Academic Director

profile_positions.description:
I started my company Verhalen OverLeven as a freelance oral historian and writer in 2008. My main activities involve oral history and (digital) story telling projects, collecting the life stories of marginalized groups and individuals, in particular migrants and their offspring. The stories are mostly published in books and websites. 
I also host story telling workshops in which people are encouraged to share their personal stories as a means to find recognition. Lastly, I organize oral history workshops and interview trainings for professionals and individuals who are interested in learning more about the method of gathering life stories.
profile_positions.title: owner

profile_positions.description: In a collaboration between Stichji and KITLV, we celebrated the commemoration of 120 years of Javanese migration by producing a book and a website based on the life stories of Javanese-Surinamese people. We collected their life stories in Suriname, Indonesia, and the Netherlands. A collection of stories was put down in the book 'Migration and cultural inheritance. Javanese life stories in diaspora'. I was the editor of the website www.javanenindiaspora.nl where we collected 50 life stories of Javanese Surinamese people. I also trained the interviewers from Indonesia, Suriname, and the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: oral history trainer/ editor in oral history project 'Javanese in Diaspora'
